title: Summing up the offseason for every AFC team: Barnwell's 16 superlatives
content: The Bengals have an unhappy star. The Patriots have turned over their roster. And the Raiders are in line to take a huge step forward.

title: Which rookies will make biggest impact? Projecting first-year leaders in 10 stat areas
content: We predicted the NFL's top rookies in 10 different stats for 2025. Who will dominate box scores this fall?

title: Longtime Colts owner and CEO Irsay dies at 65
content: Jim Irsay, who had led the Colts since 1997 and presided over one of the storied franchise's greatest eras, died Wednesday.

title: Rebuilding Blackhawks hire Blashill as head coach
content: Jeff Blashill, the ex-Red Wings coach who has been an assistant with the Lightning for the past three seasons, will be the Blackhawks' next head coach, a source told ESPN.

title: Wolves' Edwards fined for postgame profanity
content: The NBA fined Wolves star Anthony Edwards $50,000 for "using profane language" during a news conference following Minnesota's Game 1 loss to Oklahoma City.

title: Modrić to leave Real Madrid after Club World Cup
content: Real Madrid legend Luka Modrić has announced he will leave the club after the end of this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Penske focused on moving forward after firings
content: Roger Penske personally told Will Power about the firings of Team Penske's top three executives -- a decision Power said his boss made after a sleepless night contemplating how to handle a cheating scandal ahead of the Indianapolis 500.

title: Knicks acknowledge they 'let off the gas' late
content: The Knicks led the Pacers by 14 points with under three minutes to play Wednesday night, but through an array of defensive mistakes and costly turnovers, they lost in overtime to open the Eastern Conference finals.

title: Asian hoops league hopes to produce 'next Yao'
content: The new Asian University Basketball League hopes to bring together the top colleges across Japan, China and Korea and beyond -- and also to produce the NBA's next Asian superstar.

title: Sabalenka, Sinner top seeds in French Open draw
content: The 2025 French Open draw was announced Thursday, with Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz earning top seeds on the men's side, while Aryna Sabalenka and Coco Gauff are atop the women's draw.

title: 📈 MLB Power Rankings: A new team at No. 1
content: Detroit continues its meteoric rise up our list ... all the way to the top spot in Week 8, bypassing two dominant NL teams.

title: Are the NBA playoffs too physical? Have the refs actually lost control? Here's what the data says
content: The discourse -- and discord -- surrounding playoff officiating isn't new. But this year, players and coaches have wondered if the league has lost control. The NBA says its ref data is in line with past years. Who's right?

title: Inside the world of NBA 'ball boys,' the league's unsung heroes
content: Ball boys are everywhere on the court but are rarely seen or acknowledged. And yet, the NBA couldn't function without them.

title: What this epic Knicks collapse means for the series -- and for New York's title chances
content: As the Pacers rallied in Game 1, the Knicks faced a burden few franchises carry: 50 years of history.

title: The 12 most impactful NBA draft withdrawal decisions for college basketball
content: Milos Uzan, Alex Condon and other college hoops stars whose NBA draft decisions could materially shape 2025-26.

title: Hurricanes-Panthers Game 2 preview: Key players, matchup notes, stats to know
content: Florida dominated Carolina in Game 1 to the tune of a 5-2 win. Will the outcome be different Thursday?

title: Defense has turned Cardinals into contenders -- and set up a trade deadline dilemma
content: St. Louis might have baseball's best gloves. Will that mean the Cards hold on to their best arms this summer?

title: Olympic-style event in 2026 to feature PED use
content: A new company hoping to infuse PEDs into Olympic-style sports says it will hold its first formal competition next May.

title: Stop worrying and celebrate the tush push -- all the reasons it deserved to live
content: Some believe the play is unstoppable, and now it has proved unkillable -- even for the NFL and its owners.

title: LME's Premier League 2024-25 awards: From MVP to best signing, best goal, more
content: As the 2024-25 Premier League season concludes Sunday, it's time for LME's annual awards. Who earned the highest praise this season?

title: Ange Postecoglou keeps his two-year promise with long-awaited trophy for Tottenham
content: Tottenham Hotspur ended a 17-year drought by winning the Europa League, as Manchester United go back to square one on a disappointing season.

title: The secret routines fueling NBA players' grip on the game
content: Whether it's hand cream or powder, the on-court routines of NBA players have become a leaguewide obsession.

title: Can F1's rule change add action to the spectacle of Monaco?
content: The quirks that make Monaco unique also make it terrible for F1 racing. Will a new rule change fix that?

title: Can Arsenal upset Barcelona?
content: Underdogs Arsenal face champions Barcelona in the 2025 UEFA Women's Champions League final, but who will come out on top?

title: Manny Pacquiao's boxing success relies on the things he has probably lost
content: Manny Pacquiao has won titles in eight divisions, but even for him, Father Time could be a tough opponent to beat.

title: Sources: Pulisic won't play for U.S. at Gold Cup
content: AC Milan and United States attacker Christian Pulisic won't be part of the team that takes part in the Gold Cup, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Amorim: Won't seek payoff if Utd don't want me
content: Ruben Amorim has said he will not seek compensation from Manchester United if they decide he is not the right man for the job after the Europa League final defeat to Tottenham Hotspur.

title: 'Serial winner' Ange unsure on future: 'Que será'
content: BILBAO, Spain -- Tottenham Hotspur boss Ange Postecoglou has insisted he is unaware of any meetings about his future at the club, but said "whatever happens, happens" after ending Spurs' 17-year wait for a trophy.

title: Son ends Spurs drought: 'Let's say I'm a legend'
content: Captain Son Heung-Min accepted the tag of Spurs legend after lifting the club's first trophy in 17 years following a victory in Wednesday's Europa League final.

title: Sources: Endrick out of CWC, Bellingham set for op
content: Real Madrid forward Endrick will be out for two months and miss the Club World Cup with a hamstring injury, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: NWSL's Boston to play opening season at Gillette
content: Boston Legacy, a 2026 NWSL expansion franchise, will play its first season at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts, due to delays with the redevelopment of its proposed home stadium.

title: Flick signs new Barcelona deal after LaLiga win
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick has extended his contract with the club after guiding them to the LaLiga trophy, signing a new deal until 2027.

title: Sources: USMNT's Cardoso top target for Atlético
content: Johnny Cardoso is Atlético Madrid's top target as they look to strengthen the midfield line in the summer transfer window, sources have told ESPN.

title: WWE 2K25's first character pack is out, Tyrese Haliburton will join the next one
content: The New Wave Pack has also added 40 new moves and taunts, plus signature maneuvers for the wrestlers included.

title: Detroit's HR potential soars? Skenes worth trading? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: How intel agencies busted major ISI plot to attack defence sites in Delhi
content: Indian intelligence agencies successfully dismantled a Pakistan-linked espionage ring, preventing a potential terrorist strike in Delhi. The operation led to the arrest of Pakistani operative Ansarul Miya Ansari, who was gathering sensitive military data, and his Indian accomplice, Akhlaque Azam, who provided logistical support.

title: EAM Jaishankar exposes Pak army chief's hand in Pahalgam attack
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar highlighted the Pakistan army chief's religious views as a factor in the Pahalgam attack, where terrorists killed 26 civilians after identifying their religion. He asserted India's claim over Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, demanding its return. While Jaishankar acknowledged that several countries, including the United States, reached out during the crisis, he also made it clear that the ceasefire resolution was entirely bilateral, not mediated by any third party.

title: How two trespassers breached tight security at Salman Khan’s Galaxy apartment
content: In separate incidents, two individuals were arrested for trespassing at Salman Khan's Mumbai residence. Jitendra Kumar Singh, a fan, attempted to enter Galaxy Apartments on Tuesday, while Isha Chabria claimed she was invited by the actor the following day. Both were apprehended and face house trespassing charges.

title: 'Ties are built ...': India's strong message to Turkey, China for backing Pak
content: India anticipates that Turkey and China will press Pakistan to cease its backing of cross-border terrorism, especially after the Pahalgam attack raised concerns about Turkey's ties with Islamabad. NSA Ajit Doval conveyed India's firm stance against terrorism originating from Pakistan to Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in May.

title: Indian-American who 'shamed' Microsoft CEOs at anniversary, disrupts again
content: Indian-American engineer Vaniya Agrawal, previously known for disrupting Microsoft's 50th anniversary, recently protested at the Build 2025 developer event. Agrawal, along with ex-Microsoft employee Hossam Nasr, confronted Microsoft's AI security head, Neta Haiby, over the company's contracts with Israel.

title: Woman shot at outside CIA headquarters in Virginia
content: A security incident occurred early Thursday at the CIA headquarters in Virginia. Security guards shot at a woman near the main gate. The gate was closed, and employees were asked to use alternate routes. Fairfax County police are assisting with traffic control. The shooting was nonfatal. Further details about the suspect are awaited.

title: Several dead after small plane crashes into residential area in US
content: A Cessna 550 crashed into a San Diego residential area early Thursday, igniting fires in approximately 15 homes and prompting widespread evacuations. The crash, described as a "direct hit to multiple homes," occurred in the Murphy Canyon neighborhood, near Montgomery-Gibbs Executive Airport.

title: Harvansh Singh: Father a truck driver in Canada, son dons gloves for India U-19
content: India U-19 wicketkeeper-batter Harvansh Singh hails from Gandhidham, a small town in Gujarat's Rann of Kutch. Growing up, he saw his father, Damandeep Singh, and uncle, Kunwarajeet Singh, play cricket in their town while also donning the keeping gloves. Now, Harvansh's family is settled in Canada. His father drives a truck in Brampton. Harvansh lives in Gandhidham with his mother and has made a promise to his father that one day he will get them back to India.

title: Danish co returns keys of Tesla cars, says: We as a company have chosen to...
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Trump’s $5 mn gold card visa to be launched? US Comm Secry provides update
content: The US Commerce Secretary announced a new "gold card" visa program, initiated by President Trump, aimed at attracting wealthy international investors. Requiring a $5 million investment, it offers permanent residency, work authorization, and a path to citizenship, potentially replacing the EB-5 program. Strong interest is anticipated, with the initiative framed as a strategy to reduce the national debt.

title: One month since Pahalgam attack: How India has punished Pak since April 22
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that claimed 26 lives, India-Pakistan relations have deteriorated significantly. India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty, leading Pakistan to put the Simla Agreement on hold. Operation Sindoor, a decisive military response, targeted terror infrastructure inside Pakistan, followed by Indian airstrikes on Pakistani airbases.

title: Why UK just handed over an island to Mauritius
content: The UK has agreed to transfer sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, ending decades of British control. This controversial deal allows the UK and US to retain joint use of the Diego Garcia military base for 99 years.

title: Google co-founder gifts $700M in shares—Here’s where they usually go
content: Google's co-founder, Sergey Brin, recently gifted Alphabet shares worth nearly $700 million, according to a regulatory filing. The recipient remains undisclosed, sparking speculation about potential donations to charity, financial trusts, or investment vehicles. This follows Brin's previous philanthropic gestures, including a $600 million share donation in 2023 and over $100 million in donations earlier this year.

title: WATCH: Scary scenes in GT vs LSG as Arshad Khan collapses twice
content: In an IPL 2025 match between Gujarat Titans and Lucknow Super Giants, GT won the toss and chose to field. GT bowler Arshad Khan had a tough start, falling twice during his run-up in the second over, causing concern but fortunately, he managed to complete the over after physio attention.

title: Govt to auction Rs 27,000 cr worth of securities, split into two tranches
content: The government is set to re-issue dated government securities totaling Rs 27,000 crore on Friday, split between securities maturing in 2029 and 2054. The Reserve Bank of India will conduct the underwriting auction using a multiple price-based method. This move aims to enhance transparency and promote better investment planning, contributing to the stability of the Government Securities market.

title: Rishabh Pant to leave LSG after this IPL season? He responds
content: Rishabh Pant refuted social media rumors suggesting his release from the Lucknow Super Giants, dismissing claims that his Rs 27 crore price tag was deemed excessive. Pant urged for responsible and credible news reporting, criticising the spread of misinformation.

title: Soldier killed during encounter with terrorists in J&K's Kishtwar
content: A soldier died in a gunfight with terrorists in Kishtwar, Jammu and Kashmir. The operation, named 'Op Trashi,' is ongoing in Chhatru. Joint forces initiated it after intelligence about 3-4 Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists. Operations intensified after the Pahalgam attack on tourists. India responded with strikes in Pakistan-occupied Jammu & Kashmir but paused after Pakistan requested a ceasefire. Security operations continue.

title: ‘Most significant piece...’: Trump’s ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ clears House by one vote
content: House Republicans narrowly passed President Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill," a sweeping tax and spending package, despite unified Democratic opposition and some internal GOP dissent. The bill, praised by Trump for its tax cuts and new programs, faces Senate revisions amid concerns about its impact on the deficit and social safety net.

title: 'Not blood, but sindoor flows in my veins': PM Modi's fierce message to Pak
content: In a fiery address in Bikaner, Prime Minister Modi declared India's firm stance against Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack. He asserted that India retaliated by destroying nine terror hideouts in Pakistan within 22 minutes. Modi emphasized that India will respond strongly to any attacks, with the armed forces determining the time and manner.

title: IPL: Why are Gujarat Titans wearing lavender against Lucknow Super Giants?
content: Gujarat Titans have turned up for the match against Lucknow Super Giants wearing lavender jerseys in the IPL on Thursday. The colour holds a message and serves as their initiative to support cancer awareness. GT will wear their new lavender kit for the first time this season.

title: CBI files chargesheet against ex-J&K guv in corruption case
content: The CBI has filed a chargesheet against former J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik and five others in the Kiru hydropower corruption case. This follows a 2022 request from the J&K government for a CBI inquiry into irregularities in awarding civil contracts worth ₹2,200 crore for the Kiru Hydro Electric Power Project.

title: EAM counters Trump, reveals what led to India-Pak ceasefire
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar refuted Donald Trump's claim of brokering peace between India and Pakistan. Jaishankar clarified that the cessation of hostilities occurred through direct communication after Pakistan signaled its readiness to stop firing on May 10. This followed India's 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terror sites in response to the Pahalgam attack.

title: Shivakumar’s ‘wedding gift’ spin as ED targets HM Parameshwara over Ranya Rao case
content: Enforcement Directorate's searches at institutions linked to Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara triggered a strong defense from Deputy CM D K Shivakumar, who vouched for Parameshwara's integrity amidst money laundering probe connected to a gold smuggling racket. Shivakumar downplayed allegations of Parameshwara gifting actress Ranya Rao, whose accounts are under scrutiny, asserting his colleague's honesty and commitment to the law.

title: Govt reserves 4% central housing for persons with disabilities
content: The central government has announced a 4% reservation in central government housing for Divyangjans, reflecting a commitment to empowerment and an inclusive India. This initiative aligns with the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016, and the Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan, aiming to ensure fair access and promote universal accessibility for people with disabilities in all aspects of life.

title: Savannah James shares a glimpse of daughter Zhuri dominating another sport
content: LeBron James and Savannah James' daughter, Zhuri Nova, is carving her own path in volleyball, diverging from her father and brothers' basketball focus. Savannah shared a glimpse of Zhuri's volleyball practice, showcasing her dedication to the sport. LeBron has expressed immense pride and support for Zhuri, often seen cheering her on at games, highlighting her importance in his life.

title: Derrick Harmon signs rookie deal with Pittsburgh Steelers
content: The Pittsburgh Steelers have officially signed their 2025 first-round draft pick, Derrick Harmon, to a fully guaranteed four-year rookie contract worth $17,973,604. Harmon, a defensive tackle from Michigan State and Oregon, was selected 21st overall to bolster the Steelers' run defense.

title: 'Bharat very different now': VP Dhankhar hails Operation Sindoor
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday lauded Operation Sindoor, emphasizing Prime Minister Modi's firm message to challenging neighbors and the global community that terrorism will face consequences. Speaking at Goa Raj Bhavan, he highlighted India's confident stance and the international recognition of its armed forces' capabilities during the strategic operation.

title: Man and woman try to enter Salman Khan’s home in Bandra, detained
content: A 23-year-old man from Chhattisgarh was detained by Mumbai Police for attempting to enter Salman Khan's residence, Galaxy Apartments, in Bandra. The man initially arrived at the gate, claiming to be a fan wanting to meet the actor, and later returned, blocking a resident's car to gain access.

title: When Anupam Mittal slammed 'haan haan samajh gaya' culture
content: Anupam Mittal, Shark Tank judge, recently addressed workplace miscommunication on LinkedIn. He noticed Indian employees hesitate to seek clarity due to fear of embarrassment. Mittal contrasts this with US culture, where asking questions is encouraged. He suggests strategies like asking employees to repeat instructions and observing body language. Mittal emphasizes that effective communication means being understood well.

title: 'Justice must be served': India condemns killing of Israeli diplomats
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar condemned the killing of Israeli diplomats in Washington, demanding justice for the perpetrators. The suspect, Elias Rodriguez, allegedly shot two embassy staff members near the Capital Jewish Museum, chanting "Free Palestine" during his arrest. President Trump denounced the killings as antisemitic, emphasizing that hatred and radicalism have no place in the USA.

title: Bomb threat causes panic at Punjab and Haryana high court; premises evacuated
content: A bomb threat at the Punjab and Haryana High Court in Chandigarh prompted a swift response from law enforcement on Thursday. The Quick Reaction Team and bomb disposal squad evacuated the building, while the High Court Bar Association alerted its members.

title: This Indian-origin Tesla CFO earns more than Pichai, Nadella!
content: Vaibhav Taneja, Tesla's CFO, received a substantial $139 million compensation in 2024, surpassing the pay of tech giants like Satya Nadella and Sundar Pichai. This compensation primarily consists of stock options and equity linked to performance metrics, with a relatively small portion as direct salary.

title: What is Amrit Bharat station scheme? PM inaugurates 103 redeveloped railway stations
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the redeveloped Deshnoke railway station in Bikaner, Rajasthan, along with 102 other stations upgraded under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme. This nationwide project aims to modernize railway infrastructure, focusing on enhanced passenger comfort, cleanliness, and connectivity.

title: 750 pilgrims selected for Kailash Mansarovar yatra in June 2025
content: After a five-year hiatus, the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra is set to resume in June 2025, with 750 pilgrims selected via a computerized lottery. Pilgrims will journey through Lipulekh and Nathu La routes. The pilgrimage, suspended due to COVID-19 and border tensions, is viewed as a step towards mending India-China relations.

title: 12-year-old dalit girl gang-raped, filmed by 5 schoolboys in principal's office in UP
content: In a shocking incident in Moradabad, five schoolboys, aged 12 to 15, allegedly gang-raped a 12-year-old Dalit girl inside a school principal's office after drugging her. The assault, filmed by the perpetrators, was circulated online, prompting the girl's mother to file a police report.

title: Kerala DHSE +2 Result: Websites to check results safely
content: The DHSE Kerala Plus Two Result 2025 is being declared today, May 22, at 3 PM. With over 4.44 lakh students awaiting their marks, the article guides students on checking results through official websites and warns against using unofficial portals. It explains the risks of fake websites, lists safe platforms like keralaresults.nic.in and DigiLocker, and provides a step-by-step guide to access results. Students are advised to prioritise accuracy and data safety during this crucial time.

title: Banu Mushtaq's fight for Muslim women's rights wins International Booker
content: Banu Mushtaq, a writer and activist from Karnataka, has gained global recognition for her powerful storytelling centered on resistance, gender justice, and social reform. As a prominent voice in the Bandaya Sahitya movement, she challenged patriarchal structures and advocated for women's rights within the Muslim community, including the right to offer namaz in mosques.

title: 'No talks, no trade, discussion only on PoK': PM Modi's stern warning to Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Modi, addressing a rally in Rajasthan, asserted India's firm stance on national security and counterterrorism, highlighting the recent Operation Sindoor where armed forces destroyed terrorist bases within 22 minutes. He ruled out dialogue and trade with Pakistan, focusing solely on reclaiming Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Modi warned against continued terror exports, threatening to block water flow and dismissing nuclear threats.

title: Haryana YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra sent to 4-day police remand amid espionage charges
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a YouTuber from Haryana, faces police custody. She is accused of sharing sensitive details with a Pakistani national. The individual is allegedly linked to Pakistani intelligence. Hisar police are investigating her financial transactions and digital communications. Authorities deny rumors of her conversion to Islam or marriage to a Pakistani operative.

title: 'Crossing all limits': Supreme Court raps ED over Tasmac raids, issues notice
content: The Supreme Court criticized the Enforcement Directorate regarding Tasmac raids. The court stated that the ED is exceeding its boundaries. It stayed proceedings after the ED raid on the state-run liquor retailer. The court questioned the ED's authority to raid Tasmac, citing federal principles. The ED has been given two weeks to respond. The case involves alleged financial misconduct.

title: Nifty50 below 24,550; Sensex drops over 1,000 points: Top reasons market is falling
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, tanked in trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 went below 24,550, BSE Sensex was down over 1,100 points intraday.

title: BTech graduate to Maoist: Fall of Basavaraj a turning point in India’s Maoist insurgency
content: Nambala Keshava Rao, alias Basavaraj, the general secretary of the CPI (Maoist), was killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh, marking a significant blow to the Maoist insurgency in India. Basavaraj, a former engineering graduate, rose through the ranks to become a key military strategist, orchestrating major attacks and maintaining international connections.

title: India U-19 tour of England: Mhatre to lead, Sooryavanshi named in squad
content: Ayush Mhatre, a 17-year-old Mumbai opener, has been appointed as the captain of the India U-19 team for their upcoming tour of England, which includes a series of one-day and multi-day matches.

title: Google Faces DoJ Probe For Violating Antitrust Law In AI Tech Deal: Report
content: The US Justice Department is probing whether Alphabet's Google violated antitrust law in its agreement with Character.AI that allows the tech giant to use the AI startup's technology, Bloomberg Law reported on Thursday.

title: Ramanagara District To Be Renamed 'Bengaluru South', Says DK Shivakumar
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar on Thursday announced that Ramanagara district will be renamed as 'Bengaluru South' for all administrative purposes.

title: 4 Girls Drown While Collecting Clay From Riverbed In UP: Police
content: Four minor girls, including three sisters, drowned in the Bakulahi River on Thursday while collecting clay from the riverbed, police said.

title: Iran Warns To Hold US Responsible For Israeli Attack Ahead Of Nuclear Talks
content: Iran warned it would hold the United States responsible for any Israeli attack on its atomic facilities, on the eve of a new round of nuclear talks between Washington and Tehran.

title: Retiring Top Court Judge To Return To Work 2 Days After Mother's Death
content: "I could not give time to my mother for many years, now after retirement, I will stay with her for some time," Supreme Court judge Justice Abhay S Oka was telling some lawyers shortly before his farewell ceremony started.

title: Woman Shot At, Detained By Security Guards Outside CIA Headquarters
content: Security guards shot a person early on Thursday outside CIA headquarters in Langley, Virginia, a person familiar with the matter told NBC News.

title: FAA Approves SpaceX's Starship To Return To Flight After March Setback
content: The US Federal Aviation Administration on Thursday said it approved SpaceX's Starship to return to flight after its explosive testing mishap in March, allowing Elon Musk's space company to launch the Mars rocket's ninth test flight from Texas soon.

title: President Murmu Confers 6 Kirti Chakras, 33 Shaurya Chakras
content: President Droupadi Murmu on Thursday conferred six Kirti Chakras, including four posthumously, to personnel of the Army and Jammu and Kashmir Police for displaying indomitable courage and extraordinary valour in the line of duty.

title: Rapper Kid Cudi Takes Witness Stand At Sean 'Diddy' Combs' Sex Trafficking Trial
content: Rapper Scott "Kid Cudi" Mescudi took the stand on Thursday to testify as a prosecution witness at hip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs' sex trafficking trial.

title: First-Year Engineering Student Dies By Suicide In UP Hostel: Police
content: A first-year student at Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology (MNNIT) allegedly hanged himself in his hostel room on Thursday, police said.

title: How Trump Showed Old Video To Falsely Claim White Genocide In South Africa
content: The multiple crosses were planted ahead of the event and later removed. They were not gravesites for farmers. The footage that was posted on social media also showed people setting up the white crosses.

title: UK Court Lifts Injunction Allowing Deal With Mauritius To Proceed
content: Britain can conclude a deal with Mauritius on the future of the Chagos Islands on Thursday after a judge at London's High Court overturned an eleventh-hour injunction which had blocked the agreement being signed earlier.

title: Multiple People Killed As Small Plane Crashes Into California Neighbourhood
content: Assistant Fire Department Chief Dan Eddy said during a news conference that they will be investigating whether the plane hit a power line.

title: 'Emotional Explosions, Turmoil Are Universal': International Booker Winner
content: Journalist, lawyer, author and activist Banu Mushtaq, whose "Heart Lamp" won the International Booker Prize, said her stories of Muslim women from traditional south Indian families had resonated with the global audience.

title: Video: Israel Embassy Shooting Suspect Chants "Free Palestine" After Attack
content: The suspect behind the killing of two staff members of the Israeli embassy in Washington shouted "Free, free Palestine", as he was being taken into police custody after the crime that has sent shockwaves across the world.

title: Centre Announces 4% Government Housing Quota For Persons With Disabilities
content: The Centre will provide 4 per cent reservation for persons with disabilities in the allotment of government housing under the General Pool Residential Accommodation category.

title: Small Plane Crashes Into Residential Street In San Diego
content: A small plane crashed into a residential area of southern California in the middle of the night, police said Thursday, with reports that the impact badly damaged around 15 homes.

title: Kraken To Allow Trading In Apple, Tesla, Nvidia Shares As Digital Tokens: Report
content: Crypto exchange Kraken plans to launch tokenized versions of more than 50 stocks and exchange-traded funds, including shares of Apple, Tesla, Nvidia, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

title: Greece Says Turkey Must Lift War Threat To Get Access To EU Defence Funds
content: Turkey must lift a 30-year old war threat against Greece if it wants Athens to consent to Ankara accessing European Union defence funds, Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said on Thursday.

title: Raghav Chadha Shares "Special Moment" With 2 Former PMs At Seoul Summit
content: Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha, currently on a visit to South Korea, shared a precious picture on Thursday and expressed joy over the memorable moment captured in frames, along with two former Prime Ministers.

title: All you need to know about the newest season of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal make first move for €80m Real Madrid star Rodrygo
content: Arsenal have held the first exploratory discussions to sign Rodrygo from Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Allahabad High Court refuses to quash FIR against Mohammed Zubair for his tweets on Yati Narsinghanand
content: The High Court, however, continued the interim protection from arrest granted to Zubair in December last year

title: Vellore Corpn. begins vaccination programme for community dogs
content: The aim of the drive is to reduce the risk of rabies and manage the growing stray dog population in the town, say Corporation officials

title: India reminds Turkiye, China of ‘mutual sensitivities’
content: MEA spokesperson says Turkiye expected to urge Pakistan to end support for cross-border terror; comments come after Turkiye delivered weapons to Pakistan and Beijing hosted Pakistan Foreign Minister

title: With multi-party delegations, India launches global-scale anti-terror campaign
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar takes the cause to Europe while Foreign Secretary Misri visits Japan; Shrikant Shinde begins UAE visit with meetings in Abu Dhabi

title: In HC, Centre defends revocation of Türkiye-based Celebi’s security clearance
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the court that during “unprecedented” times, providing a hearing or reasons before taking action “defeats the purpose,” especially in matters concerning national security

title: Roadmap for circular economy will be ready within six months: Pattabhiram
content: Establishment of recycling industries will generate employment and livelihood opportunities for youth, says Swachhandhra Corporation Chairman

title: Days after Amritsar hooch tragedy, 3 die consuming liquor in Ludhiana
content: Three labourers — Rinku (40), Debi (27) and Mangoo (32) — consumed liquor at a vacant plot along Noorwala Road on May 21, 2025 night

title: Kodumbalur, which was the seat of power of Irukkuvels, is an architectural marvel
content:
Silapadikaram refers to it as a place situated on the way to 
Madurai, the capital of Pandyas, from Woraiyur, the Chola capital. It is referred to as Konattu kodi nagaram (the capital city of Konadu) in Periyapuranam. It boasts temples of great beauty. Inscriptions in the temples carry vital information on the history of the region

title: Nalanda University is in take-off mode, says Vice-Chancellor
content: Sachin Chaturvedi says university expects enrolment of about 900 students in the new academic session

title: A polar bear cub, gifted by Russia, couldn’t survive the Madras heat
content: To mark the centenary of the Madras Zoo, the Madras Corporation requested the Moscow Zoo for a polar bear as a gift. In October 1955, a polar bear cub arrived in Madras. But it died in the summer of 1959, though it was housed in a ‘polar weather enclosure’

title: Salvation Army’s dispensary that became a well-known hospital near Nagercoil
content: The international charitable organisation runs many hospitals worldwide. Its first hospital was established at Putheri. In 1893, Major William Stevens set up a dispensary at the modest bathroom on the veranda for Captain Henry John Andrews to treat the poor. Captain Andrews laid the foundation for Salvation Army Catherine Booth Hospital

title: Strike paralyses normal life in Manipur’s Imphal Valley
content: The 48-hour general strike was enforced to protest the masking of ‘Manipur’ displayed on a bus carrying a team of journalists to the Shirui Lily Festival in a Naga-dominated district

title: Sishu Gruhas, Bala Sadans reel under fund crunch as they await release of budget by govt.
content: Proposals for the first quarter budget have been sent and funds will be released shortly, says official

title: Incorrect to say India doesn’t have a National Security Strategy: CDS
content: Gen. Chauhan says no nation can secure itself without a strategy in place; the important constituents of a strategy will be Policy, Processes and Organisational Structures; “I believe India has all these functioning efficiently”

title: Indian team scales world’s third-highest peak
content: Sikkim organisation unhappy as Mt. Khangchendzonga is revered as the guardian deity of the indigenous communities

title: Left parties condemn Chhattisgarh encounter, seek dialogue with Maoists
content: CPI(M) has demanded that all paramilitary operations must be halted, while the CPI, CPI(ML) and All India Forward Bloc have called for an independent inquiry into encounter

title: DYFI protest against highway contactor turns violent at Pariyaram
content: Accusing the contractor of unscientific practices and irregularities in the construction of the highway, the activists reportedly stormed the office of the company at Vilayankode, Pariyaram, around 10 a.m

title: NH-66 embankment collapse a wake-up call for engineering practices
content: Senior geotechnical engineering consultant Jayakrishnan Menon describes it as a textbook case of bearing capacity failure

title: Higher education curriculum will prioritise employment, research: Kerala Minister
content: She says Kerala’s new educational vision is a response to the need for a knowledge economy and aims at finding solutions to contemporary challenges using intellectual capital

title: KTU Board of Governors meeting adjourned due to lack of quorum
content: Only 10 members attended the meeting, which is far short of the required one-third attendance for a valid session of the 60-member statutory body. Governor unhappy with lack of attendance, seeks report from V-C

title: KPCC frames broad campaign talking points against CPI(M) and BJP ahead of local body polls
content: The KPCC faults LDF government for falsely claiming credit for big-ticket schemes, including K-Fon, which the party alleged remained primarily on paper and failed to meet its original objectives. It blamed the Centre for shoddy NH 66 construction

title: Private engineering college managements urge A.P. govt. to release fee reimbursement dues
content: Stating that the institutions were facing severe financial distress, the association representatives said further delay in payments could lead to deterioration in the quality and delivery of education

title: Renovated Chirayinkeezhu, Kulitturai railway stations inaugurated under Amrit Bharat Station Scheme
content: 13 stations under Southern Railway redeveloped for enhanced passenger amenities, multi-modal integration, and sustainability at ₹130 Crores.

title: Maoists now confined to a very small area, says Chhattisgarh CM Sai
content: Referring to the Narayanpur encounter, the CM says slain Basavaraju was considered the number one Maoist

title: 77.81% pass in Plus Two higher secondary, 70.06% pass in VHSE
content: Higher secondary pass percentage is the lowest since 2010. As many as 41 students receive a full score of 1200/1200.

title: Denial of ASHAs’ rights undermines democratic values, says Bishop
content: The Metropolitan Bishop of the Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church was speaking at a gathering held in front of the Thrissur Corporation office to receive ASHAs’ Statewide protest march

title: A city in flames
content: Kozhikode watched with bated breath the valiant efforts of firefighters in bringing a raging blaze that engulfed a shopping complex at the heart of the city under control. As two back-to-back fire accidents in a fortnight have put the city on the tenterhooks, Mithosh Joseph tries to find out what is ailing the city in fire safety aspects

title: Controversy erupts over talk on Operation Sindoor at Raj Bhavan
content: Session chaired by Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar had RSS ideologue S. Gurumurthy has the lead speaker. Satheesan expresses concern over remarks allegedly made by Gurumurthy against former Central governments and leaders

title: Call to modernise rescue units in Kozhikode with advanced facilities
content: The opening of a satellite station and the launch of at least one mobile firefighting unit exclusively for the city top the list of priorities put forth by the traders’ fraternity in the district

title: Three-member gang involved in thefts and burglaries held in Annamayya district
content: Police seize over 1 kg of gold jewellery valued at ₹1 crore, 3 kg of silver ornaments worth ₹3 lakh, cash of ₹14 lakh, two motorcycles and an autorickshaw from the accused

title: Inside story of Musk's 'DOGE'y exit from Washington
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . toi World Desk is a dedicated team of seasoned reporters and writers who strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world .

title: The Wolves' offensive evolution is stalling in the West finals
content: the Minnesota Timberwolves lost to the Utah Jazz in game 1 of the Western Conference finals . the Timberwolves went 17-4, rising out of the play-in morass to the no. 6 seed . they beat the los Angeles lakers and Golden State Warriors in five games apiece .

title: Inside Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's improbable two-decade rise
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander knocked down an 18-foot jumper to give the Thunder what should have been an insurmountable 84-60 lead over the Phoenix Suns . the Suns, behind their own Big Three, were tied for sixth, just a game out of the play-in tournament . Durant, a former MVP and two-time champ, was the no. 1 seed in the Western Conference .

title: Can the Hurricanes score enough goals to win the Stanley Cup?
content: the Carolina Hurricanes beat the skeptics 5-2 in the Eastern Conference finals . winger Andrei Svechnikov swears they have enough offense to reach the Stanley Cup final . the team was limited to one goal in game 1 of the finals against the Florida Panthers until Jackson Blake added a garbage-time power play marker .

title: Updated SP+ rankings for every FBS team, plus an early look at CFP contenders
content: the 2025 college football season starts again in 93 days . teams have averaged more than 19 transfers this offseason, up more than 40% from last season . the returning production numbers are based on rosters I have updated as much as humanly possible .

title: J.J. McCarthy, fiancée Katya Kuropas announce pregnancy
content: Adam Schefter says the Vikings always intended for J.J. McCarthy to be their QB1 heading into this season. (0:53) J.J. McCarthy  and his fiancée are having a baby. Katya Kuropas, whom the new  Minnesota Vikings  quarterback proposed to in January 2024, made the announcement on a joint Instagram post on Wednesday night. The couple revealed they are expecting a boy and that he is due to arrive in September. A post shared by Katya (@katyakuropas) Kuropas' post included a video where the two showed off their baby's ultrasound photos. McCarthy was taken with the No. 10 pick in the 2024 NFL draft after a stellar career with the  Michigan Wolverines . He tore his meniscus in the preseason and missed the entire 2024 season due to injury.

title: 16 must-watch stars, 8 must-watch matchups: Top players in the 2025 college softball super regionals
content: the 2025 NCAA softball super regionals is set for the women's college world series in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma . no. 2-seed Oklahoma will host a no. 15-seed Alabama team that looks to spoil the Sooners' five-peat quest with its talented roster . here are the must-watch players on every remaining team .

title: Why do fans boo their team, and will it happen again to Alexander-Arnold?
content: Janusz Michallik reacts to fans booing Trent Alexander-Arnold . he was coming on as a substitute against arsenal two weeks ago . but some of the home crowd chose to make their feelings known .
